721550f-b.text:
(1)
378-382 Madison Street, adjoining and sest of the S.W. corner of Jackson Street. No. 378 Madison Street, is a 2-story frame house.
1932.

The same, from a different angle.
March 23, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

721548f-a.text:
354 Madison Street, south side, between Jackson and Scammel Streets, showing a rear and side view of a vacated tenement. Note that a similar structure (No. 32) to the west is absent.
July 22, 1936

Madison Street,East from Jackson to Grand Streets. Shown through Madison Street,are buildings on the north side of Grand St,at Goerck St. with the Manhattan support of tha Williamsburg Bridge
across their tops.
March 23rd,I937
(2)The same.
April 25th,I939

June 23rd,I939

721553f-a.text:
1
Madison Street, at the N.W. corner of Jackson Street, showing P. S. 12 at that location as viewed across the several clearances for the USHA "Vladeck Houses". The photographer in both instances is on Cherry Street, at Jackson (in View 1) and Scammel (in View 2) Street's.
August 14, 1939
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr
V3
Madson Ctret, from SouthStreet, sEowing P.3, 12
ind h:se with gable.
View 3, September 18, 1239.
